#summary This page explains How-to install HeeksCNC suite under Ubuntu
#labels Featured,Phase-Requirements,Phase-Deploy

= Introduction =

There are 3 ways to use HeeksCNC suite:
  * The easiest is to use PPA to install directly Ubuntu packages
  * If you want to build it locally, it recommended to use [BuildDebianPackages Debian packaging way]
  * Or you can build it using CMake, [BuildHeeksCncUnderLinux the regular way]

= Use PPA (Personal Package Archives) =

HeeksCNC and related tools (HeeksCAD, libarea, OpenCAMLib) are daily packaged in [https://launchpad.net/~neomilium/+archive/heekscnc-devel heekscnc-devel PPA].

Note: this PPA provides development versions of HeeksCNC, HeeksCAD, libarea and OpenCAMLib.

Supported versions: Lucid (10.04 LTS), Precise (12.04 LTS), Saucy (13.10), Trusty (14.04 LTS), Utopic (14.10).

Add [https://launchpad.net/~neomilium/+archive/heekscnc-devel heekscnc-devel PPA] to your repositories list:
{{{
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:neomilium/heekscnc-devel
}}}

Update your packages list:
{{{
sudo apt-get update
}}}

Install HeeksCNC:
{{{
sudo apt-get install heekscnc
}}}

= Build it the Debian way =

This method allow you to build all Debian packages related to HeeksCNC.

Instructions are available on a [BuildDebianPackages dedicated wiki page]

= Build it the standard way =

This method allow you to build HeeksCNC and its dependencies using CMake.

Instructions are available on a [BuildHeeksCncUnderLinux dedicated wiki page] and in _README.Unix_ file in sources root directory.
